text:
Garth Stein – Umenie pretekať v daždi
🐕🏁🌦️
 
🐶 Rozprávačom príbehu je Enzo – pes, ktorý sa cíti byť takmer ako človek. Sám o sebe zvykne vyhlasovať, že žije síce v psom tele, ale dušu má ľudskú. Verí, že tak, ako sa dozvedel z dokumentu o Mongoloch, stane sa z neho po smrti človek. Enzo je už starý a spolu s nami si spomína na všetko čo prežil so svojou rodinou odkedy si ho jeho pán Denny vybral na farme. Denny je automobilový pretekár a odborník najmä na jazdu na mokrom povrchu, ktorý mnohým pretekárom robí veľké problémy. Enzo s ním zdieľa nadšenie pre automobilové preteky. Jeho najväčším zážitkom bolo, keď ho Denny zobral v pretekárskom aute na závodný okruh. Postupne do ich životov vstúpi Dennyho priateľka a neskôr manželka Eve a dcérka Zoe. Po rokoch šťastného života však sadol na túto rodinku tieň. A tak sa začína dlhý boj za záchranu jeho ľudskej rodiny, pretože tak, ako to býva pri pretekoch, „nevyhrávajú sa v prvej zákrute, mnohé sa tam však prehrávajú“.

🐶 Napriek tomu, že ide o príbeh rozprávaný psom, neočakávajte vtipnú knižku. Enzove rozprávanie je dojemné a smutné. Poznačených mám viac smutných a dojemných scén ako tých vtipných.  Minula som vlastne všetky fialové lepíky, ktoré boli určené pre scény plné emócií akými sú dojatie, smútok alebo hnev. Nepoplačete si len na tom, že Enzo je hneď na začiatku knihy na konci svojej púte, ale hlavne na príbehu jeho rodiny a útrapách, ktorými si jeho pán musel prejsť. Nájdu sa ale aj vtipné scény, ako napríklad príbeh, ktorý nám vysvetlí prečo sa Enzovi snívajú nočné mory s vranami. Celé rozprávanie je popretkávané rôznou automobilovou a pretekárskou terminológiou, ktorá síce mne nič nehovorí, ale dotvárala atmosféru. Je cítiť, že knihu písal bývalý automobilový pretekár, ktorý sa v tom vyzná.

🐶 Knihu odporúčam všetkým milovníkom psov, automobilových pretekov a silných príbehov.

🐶 Kiežby bola pravda, že sa raz s našimi psími parťákmi stretneme v ich ľudskej podobe. ❤️

📚 Book 14 📚

I don't know what I was expecting when I started this book, but it wasn't  what it turned out to be. Not that it was a bad thing. I thoroughly enjoyed the story!! I don't think that I knew it was written from the dogs point of view, but I really loved how Garth Stein approached how a dog "thinks" as opposed to other authors. Enzo was a wonderful dog to get to know! The story was heartbreaking and uplifting at the same time. 

Now I can finally watch the movie!

#theartofracingintherain #racingintherain #racingintherainmovie #theartofracingintherainmovie #theartofracingintherainbook #garthstein #garthsteinbooks #enzo #enzothedog #racingintherain

📚Read That

The Art of Racing in the Rain

Wonderful read! Really enjoyed this one as a emotional and thoughtful read. This is also my to entry for my wonderful friends @pupsplantsandplotlines giveaway /challenge for #pupsplantsandplotlines as I was able to get my pup to sit still for this one!

Enzo is a dog. But he knows he is different then other dogs because he has always felt more human then most. He knows that when his soul passes on from this life, in his next he will become a man. With his race car driver owner Denny, Enzo recalls his life learning about racing, life and what it means to be human.

Really emotional read for this one! Moments to make you laugh (everything from a dogs perspective is actually quite funny) and cry (anything sad with a dog is just about as sad as it gets..). I loved that this one felt so real! Real challenges, real characters and as my dog was looking at me, I felt like he would probably sound EXACTLY like this if he was narrating his own story.

The story feels deep yet somehow Enzo keep things simple. It’s all very black and white, right and wrong for a dog and I loved reading the story that way. You also learn a LOT about racing reading this so something else I quite enjoyed!

Worth the read for something different, emotional and wonderful all at once!

Rachel’s Rating: ⚡️⚡️⚡️⚡️

If there was an Olympic's of movies then @artofracingmovie would bring home the gold in all areas.

Someone tell me the person who decided to start using sweet baby pups to evoke & obliterate our emotions because I have some choice words. We are so undeserving of dogs. 😩 I bawled in the book & movie alike. The ending absolutely destroyed me too. If you love dogs & haven’t read this, you’ll love and hate me equally for suggesting this. 😭
⠀
Synopsis:
⠀
“Enzo knows he is different from other dogs: a philosopher with a nearly human soul (and an obsession with opposable thumbs), he has educated himself by watching television extensively, and by listening very closely to the words of his master, Denny Swift, an up-and-coming race car driver.
⠀
Through Denny, Enzo has gained tremendous insight into the human condition, and he sees that life, like racing, isn't simply about going fast. Using the techniques needed on the race track, one can successfully navigate all of life's ordeals.
⠀
On the eve of his death, Enzo takes stock of his life, recalling all that he and his family have been through: the sacrifices Denny has made to succeed professionally; the unexpected loss of Eve, Denny's wife; the three-year battle over their daughter, Zoë, whose maternal grandparents pulled every string to gain custody. In the end, despite what he sees as his own limitations, Enzo comes through heroically to preserve the Swift family, holding in his heart the dream that Denny will become a racing champion with Zoë at his side. Having learned what it takes to be a compassionate and successful person, the wise canine can barely wait until his next lifetime, when he is sure he will return as a man.” ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️💫
⠀

"There is no dishonor in losing the race. There is only dishonor in not racing because you are afraid to lose."

Just started this. Will revert with review. #booksofinstagram

🐶The Art Of Racing In Tha Rain🐶(2019)
🐶Žanr:komedija,drama,romantika, sportski 
🐶Redatelj:Simon Curtis
🐶Scenarist:Mark Bomback
🐶Glumačka postava: Milo Ventimiglia, Kevin Costner, Amanda Seyfried, Martin Donovan,...
*****
🐶Sinopsis:
Temeljen na bestseleru Gartha Steina, „Nevjerojatan život psa Enza“ iskrena je priča čiji je narator duhoviti i filozofski pas Enzo.Denny, vozača trkaćeg automobila, u potpunosti je posvećen svom duhovitom, mudrom, gotovo ljudskom psu, Enzu. Enzo je Dannyju više od kućnog ljubimca, on mu je najbolji prijatelj. Kada Denny upoznaje učiteljicu Eve; zaljube se, vjenčaju i dobiju dijete. Uz podršku Eve i Enza Denny uči kako biti obiteljski čovjek u kriznim trenutcima, koristeći lekcije koje je naučio na stazi.Kroz svoj jedinstveni uvid u ljudsku narav, Enzo pomaže svojim vlasnicima – vozaču utrka Dennyju, njegovoj ženi i kćeri – da se snalaze u životu sa svježom perspektivom.
~Ocjena:10/10
🐶🔝😍❤🤗😀💖💕🌻🥰💙💞
~Gledajući film upoznat će te i zavoljeti psa koji će svijetu pokazati što to znači biti čovjek i kako se prema ostalima treba ophoditi.
~Predivan obiteljski film ispunjen osjećajima,ljubavi,poštenjem i hrabrosti u kojem ćete sigurno uživati...
~Odlični glumci,radnja i predivni pas čine ovaj film pojmom savršenstva...
~Slike i scene iz filma govore više od tisuću riječi 🐶🥰❤😍

~Dirljiva priča o posebnoj vezi između vozača trkaćeg automobila i njegovog vjernog psa.
~Studio koji je predstavio film Marley i ja, donosi prekrasan, uzbudljiv i humorističan film nastao na temelju istoimenog romana, a ispričan je iz perspektive psa Enza, kojem glas posuđuje legendarni Kevin Costner.
~Obiteljska drama u kojoj je naglasak na psa i njegovog vlasnika koji imaju temeljit i srceparajući odnos...

The Art of Racing in the Rain by Garth Stein
-
The blurb: “The captivating and moving story of an extraordinary family, how they almost fell apart and how they were brought back together by the wisest and most loyal member - Enzo the dog.”
-
My rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️.5/5
-
Told from a dog’s point of view, The Art of Racing in the Rain is a story about Denny, his love of car racing and how he is trying to keep his family together through some very tumultuous times.

I absolutely ADORED this book! It made me smile, it made me sad, at points it hurt my heart. Enzo is such a lovable character and makes me look at pets in a completely different way. What if they CAN understand us humans?? Not only is the book written from a dog’s perspective, but also of an outsider looking upon situations, able to observe without being able to verbally react. It makes me think; if we were able to look at a scenario unfolding from a purely observational point of view, would we react differently? Would we say different things? Be more mindful of how the other person feels? Have more empathy?
-
